beading in droppable stitches b p b b p b b p b kfb 43 b p b b p b b p b kfb 41 b p b b p b b p b kfb 39 b p b b p b b p b kfb 37 b p b b p b \ 0 kfb 35 b p b b p b kfb 33 b p b b p b kfb 31 b p b b p b kfb 29 b p b b p b kfb 27 b p b b p b kfb 25 b p b \ 0 kfb 23 b p b kfb 21 b p b kfb 19 b p b kfb 17 b p b kfb 15 b p b kfb 13 \ 0 kfb 11 kfb 9 kfb 7 kfb 5 kfb 3 kfb 1 kfb = knit into front and back of indicated stitch b = knit into back loop p = purl \ = ssk slip two stitches then knit them together through back loops pink squares are worked in garter stitch blue squares show bead placement yellow indicates repeat for edges the repeat is six row tall with repeats of k3 b p b between to garter stitch edge for those beading the droppable stitches place beads on yarn before knitting slide the bead up to the top of the yarn then work the stitch push the bead to the front of the work it will make it easier to drop the stitches if all of the beads are seated the same way in the work if you aren t planning to drop all of the purl stitches feel free to place beads with a crochet hook on
